page.title: 13Recreation.
page.content: The Gardens of Crail. The Crail and District Horticultural Society was founded in 1951 and each year they hold a garden competition, flower show and a chrysanthemum and vegetable show. Approx. 500 entries received 1984. In past years Crail gardeners have specialised in achieving high standards of flower growing. Now some concentrate on vegetables, again with excellent results. Recently Bob Roger's name appeared in the Guinness Bookof Records for having grown the world's largest onion. Since then his brother Bill has done better and now holds the title. Crail one the Britain in Bloom competition in 1984. Public Gardens are neat and tidy and popular. There is a well stocked Garden Centre.
